title.rendered: How to add a custom background image to any Shopify theme

content.rendered:
Tired of the plain white background of your theme? Having a neat-looking background image on your website can be a bold way to establish your brand: a well thought, beautiful image, abstract or not, carries power with it. With that said, it’s very important to make sure you choose the right image to not scare visitors away.

Bearing that vital detail in mind, in this tutorial I’ll teach how you can add an image to any Shopify theme just in a few minutes. Let’s go!

Upload the image to your website

First things first, before showing the image to your website, we need to upload it. To do this is, we’ll upload the image to your Shopify store’s file storage. Here is a brief tutorial teaching how to do that. I’d recommend using an image that is at least 2800px wide, the height is not too important in this case. Once you’re done uploading the image come back here and we’ll move on to the coding!

Adding the image to your theme

Before proceeding with the coding, please keep the link of the image you’ll want to use handy, we’ll need it:

Now:

  1. From your Shopify admin, navigate to online store > themes > actions > edit code
  2. FInd the theme.liquid file – make sure it reads exactly theme.liquid
  3. Inside theme.liquid, find the “</body>” tag, without quotes. (press CTRL + F or command + F on Mac to search for it)
  4. Paste the following code above this tag:

    [gist]0be85df08819873e6dd8f3a02ce17005[gist]
  5. You’ll want to replace the content between url(“”) with your image’s URL. Make sure it is also between quotes.

Now your custom background image should be showing up on all pages.
